author: defi_occam
content:
But if a large staking service starts censoring transactions and many stakers decide, all at once, to unstake from that service and restake with other services, the queue will get long.  

Would be nice if there was a way to skip the queue entirely if one was simply restaking with another service. This would increase censorship resistance without compromising stability. Has anyone done any work on an EIP in this direction? Is it even possible?

author: defi_occam
content: POW miners can simply redirect their hashpower to a different pool if the one they currently use starts to censor transactions. POS stakers shouldn't have to incur multiple months of lost income to do the same with their ETH.

author: pietjepuk
content:
The security of the network takes precedence over individual profits. And for security of the network, the churn cannot be too high.

How easy it is to change providers depends on the staking services. There are those where you provide (or even handle) the validator keys, and then it's easy. Going from one (centralized) pool to another is tougher, mostly when it's an exodus. That's just a risk you take with those centralized providers I would say.

author: defi_occam
content: My point is we should make it as easy as possible for stakers to move their ETH from one staking service to another so as to penalize staking services for bad behavior. Stakers are unlikely to take such (responsible) action if the cost to do so is onerous.
